Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Campus police always on patrol. Very safe school. Police call booths all over the outside campus in case of any type of emergency.
I think they have one greek organization, for Honors students.
Lots of clubs and activities. Too many to name. Some that come to mind are student congress, Latinos Unidos club, and much more.

Students who want to stay close to their home, and want a quality education. Most teachers are very nice and friendly and want to help you succeed. If you are the type of student that is willing to try, you will breeze through it!

Classes are so much cheaper then going to a University. I would recommend you get an Associates here and then transfer to a University. Help your GPA go up and also it shows that you have shown commitment to a prior schools. Most universities don't deny transfer students.
There are a lot of clubs you can possibly join at this college.
They have a cafeteria, although the food is expensive. You will most likely find a better deal at McDonald's. Vending machines are convenient and take credit cards.
Writing papers is so important in college! Always be prepared to get multiple paper assignments throughout the semester, as they are a true test of your knowledge!
Try your hardest while you are in college, even if it is a community college like MCC. It is really a matter of trying, and you get recognized for your achievements!
Its a really good school because it is very local and close to home. It has a very small campus feel to it. Also all the teachers that I have had are very nice and ready to help you out!
pageTitle: McHenry County College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {76609=The cafeteria at MCC has recently been remodeled and offers many good choices for students. The cafeteria is open 7:30a.m.-7p.m. Monday through Thursday and 7:30a.m. to 1:00p.m. on Fridays with grill service 8:30a.m. to 5p.m. Monday through Thursday and 8:30 a.m. to 1p.m. on Friday., 182661=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 42499=Very nice on how cheap it is. It is about $2000-$3000 for books and tuition, 70097=The dining area is being remodeled this school, 2012-2013 and it looks beautiful. There are tons of vending machines around campus which have a lot of variety of snacks and drinks! I think the best part of the vending machines now is you can use your debit card instead of having to carry around cash.}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck It's cheaper than any University, but it still has the same activities a University offers. There are many clubs and sports that MCC offers to its students. Am enjoying being here I have met so many new people! The students are friendly and helpful. My English teacher made me feel welcome the moment I walked in. Am learning a lot I have learned so much! My teachers have found ways to interact with their students in a positive way. Login to rate or flag the reviews Weston from Cary, IL 05/09/2011 Reviewer is A past student here. 3 of 44 Categories Comments Great for these types of students MCC is great for all types of students.
